intro: Aydendron goyazense, commonly known as the Goyazense aydendron, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of dense forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its family.
